intro: Tetramolopium klossii, commonly known as the Kloss's tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Tetramolopium klossii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in its native habitat.
